Warrior.title: Aedam, Knight-Shifter
Warrior.detailText: Battlecry & Deathrattle: Draw a Fatigue Card. Deal its damage to all other minions.

Warrior.title: Aggressive Advertising
Warrior.detailText: Give your minions Overkill: Draw a card.
Warrior.flavorText: I SAID THE STEAK KNIVES ARE FREE WITH A PURCHASE OF OVER TWENTY GOLD! WHY ARE YOU RUNNING?

Warrior.title: Overclocking Automaton
Warrior.flavorText: When they said the machines were coming to take our jobs, we didn't think they meant literally.

Warrior.title: Punch In
Warrior.detailText: Draw a Fatigue card. Invest twice.
Warrior.flavorText: We tried to call it Punch Out, but some dwarf from Un'Goro got really mad.

Warrior.title: Board Meeting
Warrior.flavorText: Oh, no, it's not mutany! Think of it more like... Under new management.

Warrior.title: The Bottom Line
Warrior.detailText: Battlecry: Draw a Fatigue Card. Gain Attack equal to its damage.
Warrior.flavorText: Fun is not something one considers, when trimming the fat. But this... This does put a smile on my face.

Warrior.title: Redirector Gryphos
Warrior.detailText: Start of Game: If your deck has at least 15 minions, all Pirates are also Mechs, and vice versa
Warrior.flavorText: For actual flavortext on your card, press 1. To talk to a representitive, press 2. Hold, please.

Warrior.title: Crunch
Warrior.detailText: Draw a Fatigue Card. Deal its damage to a target minion.
Warrior.flavorText: Yes, the overtime will be unpaid. No, you can't get out of it. Yes, you won't see your families for months. No, you don't have permission to cry.

Warrior.title: Anger Manager
Warrior.detailText: At the end of your turn, if you've dealt at least 16 damage, Invest three times.
Warrior.flavorText: Deep. Breaths. In through. The NOSE. Out. Through the mouth.

Warrior.title: Industrial Intern
Warrior.detailText: Spellburst: Deal 2 damage randomly split among all other characters. If this was activated with an Item spell, refresh the Spellburst.
Warrior.flavorText: The progress of machine learning is actually quite terrifing. We don't care, though, since it's also incredibly cost-effective.

Warrior.title: Target Demographic
Warrior.detailText: Target an enemy minion. Launch a random minion from your deck to attack it.
Warrior.flavorText: Now, we don't actually know if this is what the market is asking for at the moment. But we figure, we've already built the cannon. Might as well give it the old college try.

Mage.title: Expense Reporter
Mage.detailText: At the end of your turn, Invest.
Mage.flavorText: Mages are notoriously great at making something from nothing. For example, in their books, we actually did GOOD this quarter!

Mage.title: Lady Ravenwood
Mage.detailText: Whenever a friendly minion dies while this is in your hand, gain +1 Spell Damage.
Mage.flavorText: This flavor text was made possible, thanks from a generous donation from the Ravenwood foundation, and players like You!

Mage.title: Staff Manager
Mage.detailText: At the end of your turn, if your hero attacked with a weapon, Invest three times.
Mage.flavorText: Think of ''Out of mana'' as an opportunity to explore other avenues of damage conveyance!

Mage.title: Tele-Marketer
Mage.detailText: Inspire Add a random minion to your hand. It costs (3) less.
Mage.flavorText: We'll stop sending you messages when you stop being so stingy. Maybe.

Mage.title: Frozen Assets
Mage.detailText: Freeze all enemeies. When you draw this, Freeze a random enemy.
Mage.flavorText: It's so difficult to keep track of all the different currencies and their exctange rates, but take our word on this; You can't afford that.

Mage.title: Store Credit
Mage.detailText: Secret: When your opponent plays a spell, add a random Mage spell with the same cost to your hand.
Mage.flavorText: Good thing you kept the reciept. You kept the reciept, right? Please tell me you kept the reciept.

Mage.title: Recount
Mage.flavorText: It's always good to make sure.

Mage.title: Time Off
Mage.detailText: End your turn. You and your opponent skip a turn.

Mage.title: Gershik, Cold Caller
Mage.detailText: Start of Game: If your deck has 15 or more spells, all Item spells are also Frost spells, and vice versa.
Mage.flavorText: Ma'am, this might be the eighth time we've reached you today, but you'll notice; you STILL haven't bought anything.

Mage.title: Illusory Intern
Mage.detailText: Spellburst: Summon a 0/2 Minion with Taunt. If this was activated with an Item spell, refresh the Spellburst.
Mage.flavorText: Pros: Bumps the headcount up. Cons: I keep trusting mirror images with my coffee order.

Mage.title: Proof of Purchase
Mage.detailText: At the end of your turn, for each Item  spell cast, deal 1 damage to a random enemy character. Lose 1 Durabillity.
Mage.flavorText: They put more than coupons at the bottom of these things, that's for sure.

Priest.title: Chastise
Priest.detailText: Deal 5 damage. When you draw this card, reduce the Attack of all enemy minions by 2 until your next turn.
Priest.flavorText: I've already given you a verbal warning. Keep this up, I might have to get someone else who's authorized to do something about this.

Priest.title: Health-Care Purveyor
Priest.detailText: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to a minion. If it's still alive, then restore 5 health to it.
Priest.flavorText: What, broken leg? Here's a Happy Pandaren bandage, walk it off.

Priest.title: Surprise Inspector
Priest.detailText: Taunt. Battlecry: Discover a Shadow spell.

Priest.title: Hostile Takeover
Priest.detailText: At the end of your turn, for 3 turns, take control of a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.
Priest.flavorText: See, this is why you read the fine print.

Priest.title: Power Word: Synergy
Priest.detailText: Give all friendly minions +1/+1 for each friendly minion type in play.
Priest.flavorText: Thinking outside the paradigm, I think we need to circumvent the negatation, and really centralize the jargon. Thoughts?

Priest.title: Arindar, Payroller
Priest.detailText: Healing a friendly undamaged minion increases its health by the amount healed.
Priest.flavorText: Who spilled the box of free doughnuts? Do you want ants? Because this is how you get ants.

Priest.title: Prophet Mar'jin
Priest.detailText: Start of Game: If your deck has at least 15 spells, all Item spells are also Shadow spells, and vice versa.
Priest.flavorText: Sorry, it says here that ''Adventuring'' is a pre-existing condition. Nothing we can do.

Priest.title: Downsize
Priest.detailText: Target a minion. Turn all its Attack into Health.
Priest.flavorText: And hey, while you're down there, could you look for my pen? I think I dropped it.

Priest.title: Micro Manager
Priest.detailText: At the end of your turn, if there's at least 3 minions with 0 attack on the board, Invest three times.
Priest.flavorText: It's less about us getting things done, and more about other people NOT getting things done.

Priest.title: Pink Slip
Priest.detailText: After your hero attacks, summon a 1/2 Stiff.
Priest.flavorText: Some people fear scrolls and spellbooks as the most dreaded written text. Those people have never been let go of a job they've worked at for 18 years.

Priest.title: Stiff
Priest.flavorText: This is the card that goes with Pink Slip!

Priest.title: Write Up
Priest.detailText: Silence a Minion. Add a 1/1 Document to your hand, that has the silenced effect.
Priest.flavorText: I don't want to have to do this Urzalorg, really, but only 61% corruption? The higher ups need to hear about this.

Priest.title: Document
Priest.flavorText: This is the card Write Up generates!

Rogue.title: Book Cooker
Rogue.detailText: If you're holding a Dragon other than this one, this minion costs (2) less.
Rogue.flavorText: Your honor, while it's true that our tax records did go up in smoke, please consider: He's just a little guy.

Rogue.title: Budget Cut
Rogue.detailText: Deal 3 damage. Overkill: The next spell you cast costs (2) less.
Rogue.flavorText: Due to prioritization in accounting, instead of a set of knifes, you'll be performing this maneuver with this pencil and this rock we found outside.

Rogue.title: Ill-Gotten Gains
Rogue.detailText: At the end of your turn for 3 turns, add a Coin to your hand.
Rogue.flavorText: You've got to spend money to make money, to spend money again, to make more money. What I'm saying is; Go halfsies with me on this counterfitter.

Rogue.title: Price Gouger
Rogue.detailText: Combo: The first card your opponent plays next turn costs (3) more.
Rogue.flavorText: Simple economics! Does someone want something that you have? Stab them.

Rogue.title: Embezzle
Rogue.detailText: Take a Class Card from your opponent's deck. If it doesn't have any, take 2 Neutral Cards.
Rogue.flavorText: Wait, that's what Embezzling is? I thought it had something to do with sequins.

Rogue.title: Gux, Murdervational Speaker
Rogue.detailText: All other friendly minions with Stealth also have Immunity.
Rogue.flavorText: Sure, you might be behind now, but you've gotta remember what our friends over at E.T.C. always say.

Rogue.title: Evrithyngos, Wholesailor
Rogue.detailText: Start of Game: If your deck has at least 15 minions, all Pirates are also Dragons, and vice versa.
Rogue.flavorText: Low, low prices! High, high mortality rates!

Rogue.title: Cut-Throat Negotiatior
Rogue.detailText: Stealth. Whenever a minion dies, gain +1 Attack.
Rogue.flavorText: It used to be Cut-Hair Negotiations, but that really only scared people will mullets.

Rogue.title: Fiscal Manager
Rogue.detailText: At the end of your turn, if you've saved at least (5) from discounted cards this turn, Invest three times.
Rogue.flavorText: Why would you hold onto all that money when you could put it into a variety of high-risk, low-payout mutual funds? Namely, ours.

Rogue.title: Trickle-Down Dagger
Rogue.detailText: Deathrattle: Summon a 2/4 Ooze that retains any buffs placed on this weapon.
Rogue.flavorText: They'll take your mana into their greasy hands and spend your mana. (They do this to disrespect you)

Rogue.title: Ooze
Rogue.flavorText: This is the card Trickle-Down Dagger makes!

Rogue.title: Outbid
Rogue.detailText: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it, and give them a coin.
Rogue.flavorText: Going once... going twice! SOLD, to the greed-rolling gnome!

Hunter.title: Goblin Auto-Miner
Hunter.detailText: Whenever a friendly Secret is revealed, Invest.
Hunter.flavorText: The instructions reccomend that you dig in graveyards, in case you find a crypt o' currency.

Hunter.title: Code Monkey
Hunter.detailText: Battlecry: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw one, and discard the others.
Hunter.flavorText: Code Monkey very simple card. With big warm fuzzy battlecry. Code Monkey like you.

Hunter.title: Pet Project
Hunter.detailText: Each player summons a 3/4 Beast with Rush
Hunter.flavorText: We'd keep this project closer to our chest, but it keeps trying to bite us.

Hunter.title: Test Pig
Hunter.flavorText: This is the card Pet Project made! Gumption best pig.

Hunter.title: Installation Wizard
Hunter.detailText: Battlecry: Gain Spell Power +1 for each friendly Secret in play.
Hunter.flavorText: Once he finishes installing all these cool cursors and toolbars, it's OVER for you.

Hunter.title: Hard Reset
Hunter.detailText: Destroy all Minions. Then, give it a second... Randomly Adapt all Minions.
Hunter.flavorText: Did you try turning it off and on again?

Hunter.title: Tat, Ecosystem Admin
Hunter.detailText: Battlecry: Draw a card for each friendly Secret revealed this game.
Hunter.flavorText: Raised in a mountain. Born in a cave. Shootin' and lootin' is all that he craves.

Hunter.title: The Wolf of Whall's Creek
Hunter.detailText: Start of Game: If your deck has at least 15 minions, all Pirates are also Beasts, and vice versa.
Hunter.flavorText: I want you to solve your issues, by becoming WOLVES!

Hunter.title: Bug Tester
Hunter.detailText: Battlecry, Spellburst, Overkill, Frenzy, & Deathrattle: Summon a 1/1 Bug.

Hunter.title: Bug
Hunter.flavorText: This is the card Bug Tester makes!

Hunter.title: Soft Launch
Hunter.detailText: Secret: Deal 4 damage to the opponent's Hero in 3 turns.
Hunter.flavorText: Oh, this? No, these aren't pies. They're bombs. We made them in a bomb factory.

Hunter.title: Task Manager
Hunter.detailText: At the end of your turn, if your hand is empty, Invest three times.
Hunter.flavorText: Phil never got the lazier peons. Sure, the job was done now, but something ALWAYS needs doing.

Hunter.title: Data Privateer
Hunter.detailText: Deathrattle: If there are cards in your deck that didn't start there, draw 2 of them.
Hunter.flavorText: Navigating the deepsea currents is risky buisness. That's why it always pays to have someone who knows their way around torrents.

Druid.title: Stalk Options
Druid.detailText: Choose One: Gain 2 Empty Mana Crystals; or Gain 5 Temporary Mana Crystals.
Druid.flavorText: Zuccini is WAY up! Grasses are down! Bail on hay! I don't care what we lose, just BAIL it!

Druid.title: BUY! BUY! BUY!
Druid.flavorText: This is one half of Stalk Options!

Druid.title: SELL! SELL! SELL!
Druid.flavorText: This is the other half of Stalk Options!

Druid.title: Druid of the Market
Druid.detailText: Choose One - Transform into a 5/3 with Overkill: Invest twice; or a 3/5 with Frenzy: Invest twice.
Druid.flavorText: Donut you realize what you be do? You're... Hurting the Econimal!

Druid.title: Bear Marketeer
Druid.flavorText: This is one third of Druid of the Market!

Druid.title: Bull Marketeer
Druid.flavorText: This is another third of Druid of the Market!

Druid.title: Mixed Marketeer
Druid.detailText: Overkill: Invest twice. Frenzy: Invest twice.
Druid.flavorText: This is the last third of Druid of the Market!

Druid.title: Appreciated Growth
Druid.detailText: At the end of your turn for 3 turns, give all friendly minions +1/+1

Druid.title: Branching Out
Druid.detailText: Summon four 2/2 Treeants. If the last spell you played was an Item, give them Rush.

Druid.title: Gwin, Record Keeper
Druid.detailText: Battlecry: Regain any Temporary Mana you've gained this game.
Druid.flavorText: Stock up on Trollblood, everyone. Looking to be another record breaking year.

Druid.title: Nysariel, Stalk Broker
Druid.detailText: Start of Game: If your deck has at least 15 spells, all Item spells are also Nature spell, and vice versa.
Druid.flavorText: Does a cow has transendental apperception? Not with that attitude, it doesn't.

Druid.title: Branch Manager
Druid.detailText: At the end of your turn, if you control at least 4 Treants, Invest three times.
Druid.flavorText: They're hoping to get promoted to at least Sapling Manager by next quarter.

Druid.title: Hedge Fund
Druid.detailText: Draw 2 cards. When you draw this, gain 1 Mana Crystal this turn only/
Druid.flavorText: The only difference between a diverse asset pool and a well maintained garden is marketing.

Druid.title: Moonlighter
Druid.detailText: Battlecry: Add 2 Moonfires to your hand.
Druid.flavorText: Can I just have one last moonfire, tonight?

Druid.title: Nest Egg
Druid.flavorText: Let the Nest Egg get some Rest Egg. Needs to wake up and feel it's Best Egg if it wants to go on a Quest Egg.

Paladin.title: Brand
Paladin.detailText: Deal 2 damage to a minion. If it survives, give it +3 Health and Taunt.
Paladin.flavorText: Working for this company will leave it's mark in such interesting ways.

Paladin.title: Promotional Voucher
Paladin.flavorText: If you redeem enough of these, you can trade them up for a decorative beach towel with Uther's face on it.

Paladin.title: Sampling Freebooter
Paladin.detailText: Deathrattle: Add a Spare Part and a Banana to your hand.
Paladin.flavorText: The sign said Take One. She interpreted that as Take One At A Time.

Paladin.title: Press Kit
Paladin.detailText: Whenever you play a Holy Spell that costs (1), draw a card.
Paladin.flavorText: The Vulpera paparazzi always keeps their flash on.

Paladin.title: Stable Investment
Paladin.detailText: Secret: Give a random friendly minion +4/+4 and Taunt in 3 turns.
Paladin.flavorText: You know what they say. When you fall of your horse, you get right back up and you eat that horse!

Paladin.title: Influencer Beriandelas
Paladin.detailText: Battlecry: Replay every 1-Cost spell you've played on enemy minions this game, targeting this minion.
Paladin.flavorText: It's always better to lead by example.

Paladin.title: Hacate, Angel Investor
Paladin.detailText: Start of Game: If your deck has 15 spells, all Item spells are also Holy spells, and vice versa.
Paladin.flavorText: From the heavens, she descended, with severe interest rates, and NO down payments!

Paladin.title: Boilerplate Armor
Paladin.detailText: Can't attack. This weapon is always active.
Paladin.flavorText: Sure, it's hot in there. But it wouldn't be as effective it shot LUKEWARM water, now would it?

Paladin.title: Crowd Pleaser
Paladin.detailText: Anytime you increase an enemy minion's stats, give all friendly minions +1/+1.
Paladin.flavorText: Vastly different than the Crowd Sneezer, who is currently indefinitely on sick leave.

Paladin.title: Media Manager
Paladin.detailText: At the end of your turn, if you've increased an enemy minion's stats, Invest three times.
Paladin.flavorText: Goodwill and kindness towards those less fortunate is VERY in, this year.

Paladin.title: Intrepid Intern
Paladin.detailText: Spellburst: Give a friendly minion +1/+1. If it was an Item spell, refresh the Spellburst.
Paladin.flavorText: She was actually the one who insisted that we pay her in experience.

Shaman.title: Developing Deepscale
Shaman.detailText: Has +1 Spell Power while you have Overloaded Mana Crystals.

Shaman.title: Feedback
Shaman.detailText: Deal 1 damage to a Minion, 3 times. When you draw this, gain +1 Spell Power until the end of the next turn.

Shaman.title: Statistical Anomaly
Shaman.detailText: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each Elemental you played last turn.

Shaman.title: Benchmark Totem
Shaman.detailText: No friendly Totem can have stats that are lower than Benchmark Totem

Shaman.title: Groundbreaker
Shaman.detailText: When your hero attacks, if you played an Elemental last turn, this weapon doesn't lose durability.

Shaman.title: Elraina, Offshore Accountant
Shaman.detailText: Start of Game: If your deck has at least 15 minions, all Pirates are also Elementals, and vice versa.

Shaman.title: Loan Shark Grhrmn
Shaman.detailText: Your Murlocs cost (0), but Overload you for their original cost.

Shaman.title: Focused Grouping
Shaman.detailText: Overload: (2) Deathrattle: summon 3 1/1 Shards with Rush.

Shaman.title: Forecast
Shaman.detailText: At the end of your turn for 3 turns, restore 6 health randomly split among all friendly characters.

Shaman.title: Liquidate
Shaman.detailText: Transform a minion into a 1/1 Elemental. Deal its original Mana cost to the minions next to it.

Shaman.title: Liquidated Employee
Shaman.flavorText: This is the minion Liquidate turns you into!

Shaman.title: Regional Manager
Shaman.detailText: At the end of your turn, if you're Overloaded for at least (5), Invest three times.

Demon Hunter.title: Due Process
Demon Hunter.detailText: At the end of your turn for 3 turns, shuffle your hand.

Demon Hunter.title: Boss Fight
Demon Hunter.detailText: Target a minion. Summon a random minion that can kill it, and give it Rush.

Demon Hunter.title: Coilskar Steward
Demon Hunter.detailText: Battlecry: Give your weapon +2 Attack. Outcast: And Durability.

Demon Hunter.title: Grob, the Disobeiant
Demon Hunter.detailText: Battlecry: Throw your weapon at a target. Equip the Pick-It Sign.

Demon Hunter.title: NO MORE!
Demon Hunter.detailText: Hero Power Give a friendly character +1 Attack until the end of the turn.
Demon Hunter.flavorText: This is the hero power for Grob

Demon Hunter.title: Pick-It Sign
Demon Hunter.detailText: All friendly minions gain this weapon's attack. At the end of your turn, lose 1 Durability.
Demon Hunter.flavorText: This is the weapon Grob equips.

Demon Hunter.title: Jassinn, Delegationist
Demon Hunter.detailText: Start of Game: If your deck has at least 15 minions, all Pirates in your deck are also Demons, and vice versa.

Demon Hunter.title: Decisive Strike
Demon Hunter.detailText: Give your hero +2 Attack and "Whenever your hero attacks, Invest" this turn.

Demon Hunter.title: Illidari Intern
Demon Hunter.detailText: Spellburst: Gain +2 Attack. If it was activated with an Item spell, refresh the Spellburst.

Demon Hunter.title: Legionary Strawboss
Demon Hunter.detailText: Rush. When this minion attacks an enemy, adjacent minions attack it too.

Demon Hunter.title: Risk Manager
Demon Hunter.detailText: At the end of your turn, if at least 6 Minions died, Invest three times.

Warlock.title: Return Policy
Warlock.detailText: Add a copy of the last minion that died to your hand.

Warlock.title: Soulless Spokesperson
Warlock.detailText: Whenever you Discard a card, Invest

Warlock.title: Chain of Command
Warlock.detailText: Overkill: Add a copy of the destroyed minion to your hand.

Warlock.title: Outsource
Warlock.detailText: Fill your board and hand with Worthless Imps

Warlock.title: Lantana, Loss Leader
Warlock.detailText: Start of Game: If your dech has at least 15 spells, all Item spells are also Fel spells, and vice versa.

Warlock.title: Churn
Warlock.detailText: Discover an opponent's minion that's been destroyed. Summon it.

Warlock.title: Infernal Intern
Warlock.detailText: Spellburst: Summon a copy of this minion. If this was activated with an Item spell, refresh the Spellburst.

Warlock.title: Recruitment Manager
Warlock.detailText: At the end of your turn, if there are at least 10 Minions on the board, Invest three times.

Warlock.title: Severance Package
Warlock.detailText: Destroy the top card of your deck. Deal its Mana cost to all enemy minions.

Warlock.title: Jilin, Prestige Pricer
Warlock.detailText: After you play an Item spell, give all friendly minions +1/+1
